text:
Something along the lines of:

```
        for market_catalogue in market_catalogues:
            df = pd.DataFrame([
                {
                    'market_id': market_catalogue.market_id,
                    'market_name': market_catalogue.market_name,
                    'market_start_time': market_catalogue.market_start_time,
                    'selection_id': runner.selection_id,
                    'runner_name': runner.runner_name
                }
                for runner in market_catalogue.runners
            ])
            print(df)
```

elements.text: Something along the lines of:

text:
If you want everything in one data frame:
```
        df = pd.DataFrame([
            {
                'market_id': market_catalogue.market_id,
                'market_name': market_catalogue.market_name,
                'market_start_time': market_catalogue.market_start_time,
                'selection_id': runner.selection_id,
                'runner_name': runner.runner_name
            }
            for market_catalogue in market_catalogues
            for runner in market_catalogue.runners
        ])
        print(df)
```

elements.text: If you want everything in one data frame:

df = pd.DataFrame([
            {
                'market_id': market_catalogue.market_id,
                'market_name': market_catalogue.market_name,
                'market_start_time': market_catalogue.market_start_time,
                'selection_id': runner.selection_id,
                'runner_name': runner.runner_name
            }
            for market_catalogue in market_catalogues
            for runner in market_catalogue.runners
        ])
        print(df)
